## Re: adjust for GOH rate to FAK Sparx

受信日時: Tue Nov 18 2025 13:26:45 GMT+0800 (Singapore Standard Time)  
From: Kazuki Masuda \<kazuki.masuda@one-line.com\>  
To: Loreto Aravena \<loreto.aravena@one-line.com\>  
Dear Loreto,

As Adele mentioned, the GOH surcharge can't be adjusted. Let me highlight

the following points:

\*1) GOH surcharge is cost-based, not market-driven\*

GOH levels are determined by MNR/SYM team based on actual equipment,

installation, and positioning costs.

Therefore, this surcharge does not fluctuate according to market rates,

regardless of competitor pricing.

\*2) The 2023 special levels were exceptional and temporary\*

The conditions at that time were very different from the cost environment

we face today and for the coming year.

For this reason, a direct comparison with 2023 levels is not appropriate.

\*3) The recent decline in FOB volume cannot be attributed solely to GOH\*

Transit time and space availability are separate operational factors and

are not driven by the GOH surcharge.

Reducing GOH alone would not address these issues.

Thanks & Regards,

Kazuki Masuda

Dear Will

No problem. I understand that it's important for you to have all the

details.

\*What is AGA?   \*The Spanish term "AGA" stands for "Agente de Aduana,"

which translates to \*Customs Agent\* or \*Customs Broker\* in English.

A Customs Broker is a licensed professional who acts as an intermediary

between an importer or exporter and customs authorities. They are

responsible for preparing and submitting all the necessary documentation,

ensuring compliance with import and export laws, and calculating and paying

duties, taxes, and other fees. Their main role is to facilitate the smooth

and legal passage of goods through customs.

\* In addition, if some party should charge the cost to someone, why do they

charge the cost to ONE, not to the CNEE directly?\*

  The reason the cost is charged to ONE and not directly to the Consignee

(CNEE) is that this is a transport cost. The transport service is a ONE

service, and the transport provider performs the service for ONE.

Therefore, the invoice is issued to us, and we then proceed to bill the

client.
